dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, have you been following what's happening over in Kazakhstan with their payment systems? It sounds like they're making some pretty big moves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, have you been following what's happening over in Kazakhstan with their payment systems? It sounds like they're making some pretty big moves.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, I saw that. They're, uh, introducing a unified QR code system for *all* banks, right? Like, a single, national standard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I saw that. They're, uh, introducing a unified Q R code system for all banks, right? Like, a single, national standard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Governor of the National Bank of Kazakhstan Timur Suleimenov outlined plans to introduce a unified QR code system for all banks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And get this, the National Payment Corporation, which is part of their National Bank, is going to be the sole operator. So, one central body overseeing everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And get this, the National Payment Corporation, which is part of their National Bank, is going to be the sole operator. So, one central body overseeing everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, the National Payment Corporation of the National Bank will serve as the sole operator of the system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's huge. I mean, they already handle, what, 90 percent of all cashless payments? [overlaps] Like, it's not a small operation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's huge. I mean, they already handle, what, ninety percent of all cashless payments? Like, it's not a small operation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Currently, 90 percent of all cashless payments are processed through this system

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] It's already massive! Five point nine trillion tenge per day. That's a staggering amount. But I'm curious, how many banks are actually on board with this right now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's already massive! Five point nine trillion tenge per day. That's a staggering amount. But I'm curious, how many banks are actually on board with this right now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: it handles 5.9 trillion tenge per day, Suleimenov said while speaking on the sidelines of the Senate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, Governor Suleimenov mentioned three banks are already connected, and another nine are in the testing phase. But the goal, and this is the ambitious part, is to connect *all* banks by the end of the year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, Governor Suleimenov mentioned three banks are already connected, and another nine are in the testing phase. But the goal, and this is the ambitious part, is to connect all banks by the end of the year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Three banks are already connected, and nine are in the testing phase. Our goal is to connect all banks by the end of the year, he added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: All of them? Wow. That's a tight deadline. How do they plan to, like, achieve that? Are they just hoping for cooperation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: All of them? Wow. That's a tight deadline. How do they plan to, like, achieve that? Are they just hoping for cooperation?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, two main approaches, it seems. Either through partnerships, which, you know, makes sense. Or, and this is the interesting part, they're pushing for legislative amendments in Parliament that would just make it mandatory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, two main approaches, it seems. Either through partnerships, which, you know, makes sense. Or, and this is the interesting part, they're pushing for legislative amendments in Parliament that would just make it mandatory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our goal is to connect all banks by the end of the year, either through partnerships or, in parallel, by pushing legislative amendments in Parliament that would require mandatory participation in the national QR system, he added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so they're not messing around. If you don't wanna play, they're gonna make you play.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so they're not messing around. If you don't wanna play, they're gonna make you play.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! Like, it's going to be a national requirement if those amendments pass.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! Like, it's going to be a national requirement if those amendments pass.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And when did this whole unified QR system even start? Was it a recent idea?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And when did this whole unified Q R system even start? Was it a recent idea?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not super recent, actually. It was first introduced last November by the National Bank and the National Payment Corporation. So they've been, uh, working on this for a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not super recent, actually. It was first introduced last November by the National Bank and the National Payment Corporation. So they've been, uh, working on this for a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The unified QR-based payment system was first introduced last November by the National Bank and the National Payment Corporation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And I wonder what the main driver is, besides just, like, efficiency?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And I wonder what the main driver is, besides just, like, efficiency?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, one thing I read, which was quite interesting, was that part of the initiative is to, um, protect tourists from scams. To just make payments more secure and streamlined for everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, one thing I read, which was quite interesting, was that part of the initiative is to, um, protect tourists from scams. To just make payments more secure and streamlined for everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Read also: 'To protect tourists from scams' â€” Kazakhstan develops QR code system

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's a smart angle. A unified, trustworthy system makes a lot of sense, especially for visitors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's a smart angle. A unified, trustworthy system makes a lot of sense, especially for visitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely. Sounds like a big step for their digital economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely. Sounds like a big step for their digital economy.
